`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:["A while ago, I published an ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://refactorfirst.com/spring-boot-api-first-design.html",children:"article"})," about how you can document REST APIs using Open API 3 specification. This was for synchronous APIs."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"Today we are going to look at how we can describe asynchronous APIs that we create when we design event-driven architectures."}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.h2,{id:"asyncapi-definition",children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{"aria-hidden":"true",tabIndex:"-1",href:"#asyncapi-definition",children:(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"})}),"AsyncAPI definition"]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"Let\u2019s look at the various parts of an AsyncAPI specification that are most useful."}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.div,{children:(0,e.jsx)(c,{alt:"AsyncAPI definition sections",src:"/static/images/2021/asyncapi/api-defition-sections.png",width:"442",height:"623"})}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.ul,{children:[`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.li,{children:[(0,e.jsx)("b",{children:"API version"}),"\u200A\u2014\u200AThis defines the version of AsycnAPI. We will be dealing with version 2.0.0"]}),`

`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"Now that we have looked at the various sections. Let\u2019s look at a minimal definition."}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.h2,{id:"example-async-api-definition",children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{"aria-hidden":"true",tabIndex:"-1",href:"#example-async-api-definition",children:(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"})}),"Example Async API Definition"]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.pre,{children:(0,e.jsxs)(n.code,{className:"code-highlight",children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`asyncapi: 2.0.0
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`info:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`  title: Banking backend events
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`  version: 1.0.0
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`servers:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`  development:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`    url: localhost:{port}
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`    protocol: kafka
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`    variables:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`      port:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`        default: '9092'
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`channels:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`  banking.transaction.000:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`    description: |-
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`      This contains events related to transactions.
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`    publish:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`      operationId: consumeTransactionEvent
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`      message:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`        $ref: '#/components/messages/transactionEvent'
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`      bindings:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`        kafka:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`          groupId: myGroupId
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`components:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`  messages:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`    transactionEvent:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`      name: trasactionEvent
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`      contentType: 'application/json'
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`      payload:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`        $ref: '#/components/schemas/TransactionEventPayload'

`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`    TransactionEventPayload:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`      type: object
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`      properties:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`        transactionId:

`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`        amount:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`          type: integer
`})]})}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:["Now, In this, I am creating an API definition to connect to Kafka, wherein a producer is publishing a transaction event to a Kafka topic named ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"banking.transaction.000"})]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.h2,{id:"how-to-read-the-asyncapi-definition",children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{"aria-hidden":"true",tabIndex:"-1",href:"#how-to-read-the-asyncapi-definition",children:(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"})}),"How to Read the AsyncAPI definition"]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"Usually, when we dealt with OpenAPI 3 specification for synchronous communication, We always knew who was the server and the client. The server implements the OpenAPI definition and the client uses the definition to know how to interact with the server."}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"Now, there is a difference in the case of asynchronous communication. We don't have a nation of servers and clients. An application can consume an event and also emit an event."}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"So let's look a little deeper at the channel section from the above definition to understand this better."}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.pre,{children:(0,e.jsxs)(n.code,{className:"code-highlight",children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`channels:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`  banking.transaction.000:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`    description: |-
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`      This contains events related to transactions.
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`    publish:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`      operationId: consumeTransactionEvent
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`      message:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`        $ref: '#/components/messages/transactionEvent'
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`      bindings:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`        kafka:
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`          groupId: myGroupId
`})]})}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:["In the channel section, we have ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"publish"})," section, which contains an operation Id, message, and binding."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:["Now, When we read the definition, we have to read it from the perspective of a viewer, who is looking at the API definition that is already implemented by a provider application. This means, If you want to interact with the provider\u2019s application (who has implemented the API definition), then you have to consume events from the ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"banking.transaction.000"})," topic."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"This was a little confusing when I was generating the code."}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"So with this understanding, Let\u2019s generate some code."}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.h2,{id:"code-generation",children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{"aria-hidden":"true",tabIndex:"-1",href:"#code-generation",children:(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"})}),"Code generation"]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:["AsyncAPI provides templates to create code from the API definition. There are quite a few code generation templates for languages like Java, Nodejs, and python. You can also generate an HTML page for the API definition using the HTML template. You can find the list of templates ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://github.com/asyncapi/generator#list-of-official-generator-templates",children:"here"})]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"We will be generating our code in Java using the Spring framework."}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:["To generate the code from the template, we would have to use an async generator command, which we can install by command-line or use a docker image to run the command. You can find more details about the installation ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.asyncapi.com/generator",children:"here"}),"."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"To install the command line utility, run the following command:"}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.pre,{children:(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{className:"code-highlight",children:(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`npm install -g @asyncapi/generator
`})})}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:["Now, We would be using the ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"@asyncapi/java-spring-template"})," to generate our API providers and viewer\u2019s code. This template makes use of the ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"spring-kafka"})," library to generate your consumers and publishers to the topic. You can find various options that are provided for this template ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://github.com/asyncapi/java-spring-template",children:"here"})]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.h2,{id:"generating-api-consumersviewers-code",children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{"aria-hidden":"true",tabIndex:"-1",href:"#generating-api-consumersviewers-code",children:(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"})}),"Generating API Consumer\u2019s/Viewer\u2019s code"]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"To generate the API consumer\u2019s code, we would have to run the following command"}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.pre,{children:(0,e.jsxs)(n.code,{className:"code-highlight",children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`ag asyncapi.yml \\
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`@asyncapi/java-spring-template \\
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`-p javaPackage=com.amrut.prabhu.consumer \\
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`-p inverseOperations=false \\
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`--force-write  \\
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`-o async-kafka-consumer
`})]})}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"You can alternatively run the command using docker in the following way:"}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.pre,{children:(0,e.jsxs)(n.code,{className:"code-highlight",children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:"docker run --rm -it -v ${PWD}:/app asyncapi/generator \\\n"}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`asyncapi.yml \\
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`@asyncapi/java-spring-template \\
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`-p javaPackage=com.amrut.prabhu.consumer \\
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`--force-write  \\
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`-o async-kafka-consumer
`})]})}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.strong,{children:"Note:"})," if you use the docker way of creating the code, It might take some time to generate, because it downloads the template every time you run the command."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.div,{children:(0,e.jsx)(c,{alt:"Async API Consumer/viewer code",src:"/static/images/2021/asyncapi/api-consumer.png",width:"391",height:"520"})}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:["Now with this, we have created a project with code to consume the events from the ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"banking.transaction.000"})," topic. The class that handles the part of consuming events is ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"MessageHandlerService"})," . It makes use of the ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"@kafkaListener"})," annotation, to define a handler for the incoming messages."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"Now let's look at generating the API provider's code for us."}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.h2,{id:"generating-api-providers-code",children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{"aria-hidden":"true",tabIndex:"-1",href:"#generating-api-providers-code",children:(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"})}),"Generating API Provider\u2019s Code."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:["To generate the API definition provider\u2019s code which in our case is the producer to the",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"banking.transaction.000"})," topic, we would have to run the following command"]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.pre,{children:(0,e.jsxs)(n.code,{className:"code-highlight",children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`ag asyncapi.yml \\
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`@asyncapi/java-spring-template \\
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`-p javaPackage=com.amrut.prabhu.producer \\
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`-p inverseOperations=true \\
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`--force-write  \\
`}),(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"code-line",children:`-o async-kafka-producer
`})]})}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:["Now, here the command is pretty much the same, but a small difference. In this case, we have to set the ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"inverseOperation"})," property to true. This tells the generator to generate the code as the provider of the API definition."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.div,{children:(0,e.jsx)(c,{alt:"AsyncAPI provider's code",src:"/static/images/2021/asyncapi/api-provider.png",width:"364",height:"442"})}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:["In this case, We have the ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"CommandLinePublisher"})," that publishes a message to Kafka. It internally makes use of ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"PublisherService"})," to publish the message using the ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"KafkaTemplate"}),"."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.h2,{id:"conclusion",children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{"aria-hidden":"true",tabIndex:"-1",href:"#conclusion",children:(0,e.jsx)(n.span,{className:"icon icon-link"})}),"Conclusion"]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:["In this article, we had a look at how an AsyncAPI definition looks like and also generate code using a code template. Some things can be a bit tricky to understand but they have wonderful documentation which you can refer to ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.asyncapi.com/docs/specifications/v2.0.0",children:"here"}),". I feel the code templates need some improvement but I can understand the templates are still in their early stages."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"As to how we have OpenAPI as standards for documenting REST APIs, AsyncAPIs, I guess would become a standard for documenting asynchronous or event-driven architectures."}),`

toc.value: How to Read the AsyncAPI definition

frontMatter.title: Defining Event-Driven Architectures - AsyncAPI
frontMatter.author: Amrut Prabhu
frontMatter.summary: In this article, I am going to be talking about how we can define your event-driven architectures using the AsyncAPI definition
